TextBody:
Hi Pete,

Thanks for reaching out!

In order to make sure they are not taking up licenses, you can double check in System Configuration -> System Licensing -> View Licenses.
If those computers are not showing up there, you can delete them from Device Control -> Computers.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

TextBody:
Hi Pete,

You can remove the licenses from those computers by clicking the red button on the right side.
You can also set up Automatic License Release to automatically remove them from computers which haven't been online in a specific time.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

Kind Regards,
Pete

TextBody:
Hi Pete,

Thanks for clarifying!
It would be better to start fresh with them, so it's best to delete them.
You can delete multiple computers at once by selecting them, and clicking on the Delete button on the bottom of the page.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer

Hi Pete,

Thanks for reaching out!

In order to make sure they are not taking up licenses, you can double check in System Configuration -> System Licensing -> View Licenses.
If those computers are not showing up there, you can delete them from Device Control -> Computers.

Best regards,

You can also set up Automatic License Release to automatically remove them from computers which haven't been online in a specific time.
